UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user profile, which can be a business or a buyer.

uid.description: The user's unique ID from Firebase Auth.

role.description: The user's role in the application.

businessName.description: The name of the business (for business roles).

fullName.description: The full name of the user (for buyer role).

category.description: The primary business category (for business roles).

address.description: The user's or business's full address.

city.description: The city of the user or business.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the account was created.

isAdmin.description: Flag to indicate if the user is an administrator.

purchaseHistory.description: List of order IDs for a buyer.

ghostCoins.description: The number of reward coins a buyer has.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Represents a category of business (e.g., food, electronics).

name.description: Name of the category (e.g., Food, Electronics).

description.description: A brief description of the category.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product line or brand sold by a business.

userId.description: Reference to the UserProfile of the business owner.

name.description: Name of the product line or brand.

description.description: Detailed description of the product line.

status.description: The current status of the product.

inventory.description: Total inventory count for all varieties of this product.

varieties.description: Different versions of the product (e.g., size, color).

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a guest or buyer.

buyerId.description: Reference to the UserProfile of the buyer.

businessId.description: Reference to the UserProfile of the business fulfilling the order.

/users/{userId}.description: Stores all user profiles, for both businesses and buyers. Uses the Firebase Auth UID as the document ID.

/products/{productId}.description: Stores all product lines. Products are linked to owners via the 'userId' field.

/orders/{orderId}.description: Stores all orders placed in the application.
